website_summaries.verdict: This basic tripod is better for use with the included grill surface than with heavier dutch ovens.
pros: Shock-corded legs collapse for easy transport and storage
Can raise and lower your cooking surface to adjust to the fire
cons: Legs do not lock at the top
they are held together with elastic like tent poles
If you like something more secure, you can add your own bolts

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first use
customer_reviews.text: Using the grill the first time was disaster. The grill doesn't hang straight because the connectors can slide an entire wrung (they need eyelets). It's very flimsy altogether. I tried cooking a pizza over a campfire, an old past time of mine, and we lost a pizza to the fire because of how unstable it is. When the fire was bigger it heated one of the legs and the internal elastic line melted. I'm bummed it has to go to the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Nate C

customer_reviews.title: Does the job if you’re careful but there are better products out there
customer_reviews.text: It did the job but the grill swings almost constantly and if the weight of the food is not perfectly spread out it leans pretty hard. Lost quite a bit of food into the fire between the swaying and the uneven platform. My boyfriend had to keep holding it in place with tongs, especially when you flip the food. Also when we were taking it apart the day we were packing to go home, we found that the black elastic strings inside the tripod legs had melted and snapped in half. The legs still click together so it’ll work, but it’s still stupid they would make something designed to go over a fire that has parts that melt.
customer_reviews.author: MoLorraine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect...
customer_reviews.text: Beats holding sticks near a fire for an hour! Set it and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Jindrek Kowalczyk

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and super convenient for the campfire! Everyone loved it! Campfire cooking won't be the same for you again!
customer_reviews.author: J9

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for 4 camping trips and it is still amazing. It has an easy adjustment if you want to slow cook. Works well with my cast iron dutch oven. After cooking i hang my vintage lantern securely. I am going to get another just for my lantern. The legs lock and fold up for very little space. I bought a pricier one that was too short. This one is higher. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen M

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The top of the tripod didn't fit the legs properly, so it didn't even stand well (and it CANNOT be moved or shifted once you finally get it to stand, or it will fall). I couldn't trust to put my food on it so it hasn't been used. Really disappointed in the Coleman brand and I wish I had spent a little more for something substantial.
customer_reviews.author: aspahn

customer_reviews.title: Love using it
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. Love using it. Stands up to the heat and weather really well. The only issue I have is the legs are held together with the same stretchy string they use in tent poles. They don't lock together either, so when you try to move it when it's standing up the legs fall apart. I had to drill holes in all the leg connections and put a nut and bolt in each one. Now when I move it the legs don't fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Simple set up. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep on the boat for when we camp and or just grill out while on the river. Super easy to set up and take down. I dont think its sturdy enough to place heavy items on like a Dutch oven, albeit I haven't tried, but it was perfect to grill burgers, steaks, fish, & veggies. In the morning it was great to have a flat surface to boil water for coffee. I'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Good light foldable tripod
customer_reviews.text: Good little product for light cooking. I use it mostly for frozen pizza’s. The poles fit easily into the ground and set up is a snap. Also the poles break down for travel be easy to put in a backpack. But the way it just dangles from the chain makes it a little impractical for heavy usage. Would recommend. For light cooking.
customer_reviews.author: ooo1 Raven 1ooo

customer_reviews.title: Check before camping legs Assembled wrong
customer_reviews.text: Grew up with this product my parents had the same one for over 20 years. The one I was sent was assembled incorrectly. One of the poles had the wrong joints and can not connect. We had to duct tape it to use it camping.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Lysaght

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: The slots that the dimples slide in to weren't deep enough and I had to pound the legs together with a hammer to get them to fit. The locking tang inside the leg slid came loose and slid inside the leg and I had to fish it out with a fishing hook. Once it was set up, it wouldn't stop swinging and I had to tether the grate to the legs with wire to keep it over the fire. Probably be just fine to hang a lantern off of. Junk to cook on.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty Werbenjagermanjensen

customer_reviews.title: This is a very light duty product.
customer_reviews.text: Great for someone who wants to use a product like this once or twice a year. Grill material is very light weight and started to sag under the weight of a pry pan while over the fire... Light build.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J

customer_reviews.title: Pro- Sturdy once put together grate seems durable easy to clean ...
customer_reviews.text: We put this together to use over the fire for camping. Look at the pro con list below. Pro- Sturdy once put together grate seems durable easy to clean adjustable grate height Con- Hard to move once in place The tent like poles do not seem like they will last if always around a fire. (will report after more use) No real way to hook poles in at the top All in all the grill achieved its purpose for the camping trip. The durability of it remains to be seen, but for the price it is hard to go wrong, as it does its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, poor value.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not too impressed with this. The construction feels flimsy and low quality. When we adjust the grill height it’s very clunky and rough. The concept is good but the clips to hang the grill are cheap and we worry that the grill will just flip over and dump our food in the fire.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie R.

customer_reviews.title: This is a must for camping/kayaking
customer_reviews.text: This set packs down well! We kayak and camp a lot and it’s a staple for us on every trip to bring this set. We usually cook dinner and breakfast on it and make coffee. It’s easy to adjust over a fire and transport. This is our third set we’ve had over the years and they are very durable.
customer_reviews.author: KCKayakgirl4

customer_reviews.title: It's nice to use, but I wish the grate had sides
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this is real nice to have, but be really careful with round food aka hotdogs, or pots that can easily slide or roll off the end of the grate.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N. Kafes

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but I think you could do better.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, poorly executed. I don't know about you, but when I build a campfire, I build a camp FIRE. This product cannot stand the heat, literally. It has those elastic cords in the legs (to make them conveniently collapseable). Good idea, right? No. They literally started smoking acrid, and I'm sure, toxic, fumes within minutes of setting up over the campfire. So the convenience is gone. Other than getting incredibly sooty, it worked okay once all the elastic burned up. Can be hard to balance things on the grate.
customer_reviews.author: David Ganio

customer_reviews.title: Fits right over my fire pit perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, store and use. The only issue is balancing the weight of the food you place on the grill surface or it will tip and fall into the fire. I use it to roast corn so tipping is less of an issue because I cook them in the husk.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Corneail

customer_reviews.title: Delivered weeks ago, just set up and Broke in two minutes. I can’t return it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very serious review; DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. I just set it up and placed my Dutch oven on it. It broke within two minutes. If you want to cook on the grate, that’s fine. DON’T HANG ANYTHING ON IT. I just opened the shipping box and set it up. It broke In two minutes. The return date has passed so now I’m out almost thirty dollars with a just opened broken product.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works good over a fire
customer_reviews.text: Overall this was nice little item for camping. It takes 10 minutes to put it together but wasn't hard. It goes up and down over fire easily, but bring a leather glove, the chain can get warm.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this tripod for over a campfire. The grill cleaned off great with soap and water and a mild scrubby. The tripod stayed in place during heavy wind so I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: MKZ

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: First, this product is AWESOME! We didn’t even use the grill on our campsite fire ring the entire 4 days we camped. And what a conversation starter. We had so many people stop by our campsite to ask us about it! We love it. Sturdy. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for camping
customer_reviews.text: This tripod works perfect for our camping trips. Its easy to set up and can be lowered and raised with ease. Nothing beats a burger over a campfire.
customer_reviews.author: Romby

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! Especially if you plan to put it next to a fire! Inside all the legs / tubing is an elastic band to hold them together. Needless to say, something like a warm fire will melt them. The legs that are supposed to be held together fall apart. The tripod works well, but it's not durable and you'll end up buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: M&L

customer_reviews.title: Can’t do fire pit without it.
customer_reviews.text: Fine product. Coleman always meets expectations. Thin, light and easy to use. Food tastes much better when cooked/grilled over fire than on gas grill.
customer_reviews.author: Izzi

customer_reviews.title: The tripod grill works great! We've used this a few times and it ...
customer_reviews.text: The tripod grill works great! We've used this a few times and it seems to pretty durable, especially for the price. It is easy to put up and take down, and I love that the grill is adjustable to get closer or further away from the fire. In the past, I have had troubles with the chrome peeling off of these, but this one has been used quite a bit and we still haven't had anything peel on it. This is a great product and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Jackson

customer_reviews.title: A camping must-have
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tripod because the fire grates at our campsite are too small and we needed more room. This turned out to be one of our most convenient camping purchases. It’s very lightweight but durable. Assembly was so easy my teenage daughter put it together for us.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Best way to cook over a wood fire.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace another tripod by the same manufacturer (the first one had lost its internal bungee cord due to heat exposure). This one is more sturdy and has nice "spikes" on the end of each of the rods to secure into the ground. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Marusik

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for how inexpensive it is.  Kinda flimsy though.
customer_reviews.text: This grill was great. I don't have much to say about it other than it is a bit flimsy. It may just be the way I put it together but it didn't seem very solid in the legs. Everything else was great though.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Hubred

customer_reviews.title: A light duty grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill isnt made to be left over the fire. Mother in-law had one last camping trip and liked it. So I ordered one. I removed mine when not cooking and used it to hang a lantern. Mother in-law said she warped hers but i belive that was do to over exposure to heat. Other than some cooked on grease mine still looks new. If taken care of this should last some time.
customer_reviews.author: N6WOLF

customer_reviews.title: Camping
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for our camping trip. Noticed when packing up one interior leg elastic already shredded. It may have gotten too warm. I don't think it will be an issue though.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Van Camp

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Its super flimsy! If you wanna hang a lantern, then its okay but come on spend 30 bucks for a lantern hanger???? I was going to use it for a cast iron pot but gave up because I dont trust this.
customer_reviews.author: Hoon

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: It holds up pretty well and very easy to set up or use it for my cast-iron and it can actually hold it
customer_reviews.author: Kendle Langley

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easily assembled
customer_reviews.text: Very light, easy to store and assemble. Works great. Can be adjusted for cooking temps.
customer_reviews.author: TripleMac

customer_reviews.title: Descent grill for camping or cooking over fires
customer_reviews.text: Nice grill for camping. Food can easily fall if so it requires some focus when placing on grill. Not meant to hold much weight but it gets the job done if your cautious. Worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this would have been a great purchase for the price had all the parts been in the box.
customer_reviews.author: scwerl

customer_reviews.title: “Stereo” instructions
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are terrible, finally got it together. Works fine over wood fire.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill for cooking over the fire.. we love to camp and cook over the fire! We have 3 of them!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Guido

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive tripod to cook over open fire. No complaints. Recommended to others also.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grilling anywhere!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a place in the woods that had a fire pit and had some chorizo and carne asada meat so decided to test this sucker out. For the price plus I had a amazon promotion, I’m so pleased with the results. Not only is if Coleman, it’s easy to assemble and disassemble, super simple to clean and store away.
customer_reviews.author: TONY G

customer_reviews.title: Not Coleman quality
customer_reviews.text: Kinda disappointed in the quality with this being by Coleman. It’s really flimsy and is barely strong enough to hold a Dutch oven
customer_reviews.author: Emily Benfer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap light and works great.  We take it on all our camping trips.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I put pots full of water on the chains and it holds up. Price cant be beat.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: Nice easy to set up and use. Only issue we had was it was useless at our state parks with how the fire pits are set up
customer_reviews.author: Odin45

customer_reviews.title: rusted pretty quick when left outside (which is where it belongs)
customer_reviews.text: rusted pretty quick when left outside (which is where it belongs)
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Great for campfire super
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great addition to our campfire suppers. Wouldn’t be sturdy enough for heavy soups though.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hiser

customer_reviews.title: Very unstable tripod
customer_reviews.text: The polls do not lock like there suppose to makes it unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great durable functional grill
customer_reviews.text: We had ours for years and our sons-in-law said they wanted one when they saw it for the first time last summer. I got them each one for xmas, loved their smiles!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie McAdoo

customer_reviews.title: Quality is okay and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I put this together for the first time and it was super easy. I've never put one together and it took less than 10 min. The quality is just okay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works like a charm even though when It arrived one of ...
customer_reviews.text: This works like a charm even though when It arrived one of the bands inside one leg section was broken... The grill surface is quite large. I put 30 hotdogs on it at one time... and turned it by hand as they roasted and had no trouble adjusting it above the open flame I would recommend this grill ,
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Assembles quickly, packs slim.
customer_reviews.text: Use it every time I camp. Easy to assemble, packs slim. Need to be careful not to get legs too close to fire. Bungee cord inside pole will melt. Also, at times, I've lost food into the fire because the grate gets off balance when shifting food around. But this is my third one and I will buy it again if I burn the bungees on the one I have now.
customer_reviews.author: CNINGHM

customer_reviews.title: never buying this product again and wouldnt recommend. swings all over the place
customer_reviews.text: never buying this product again and wouldnt recommend. swings all over the place. impossible to get it level. bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Nudy/Mann’s

customer_reviews.title: The older model worked far better. This one you have to dig into the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this. The older model worked far better. This one you have to dig into the ground or it falls over easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: Great using while camping
customer_reviews.text: Great using while camping. Got a lot of great comments from neighboring campers who had a portable grill with charcoal and had a pit going at the same time. The best part it was light and worked great. Used the fire pit to cook dinner, enjoy the fire and burnt some marshmallows at the same time with one fire.
customer_reviews.author: Ry

customer_reviews.title: okay quality
customer_reviews.text: Arrived timely and as described, a little lighter duty than anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Zednick

customer_reviews.title: Nice value
customer_reviews.text: Works well and good value for price. Will have fun trying lots of fun trying new recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Aanbuwacl

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Sturdy. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Used over the fire all weekend. Sturdy. The raise/lower system works very well. We never had any trouble of stuff possibly tipping off the edges or anything. Would highly recommend. My husband kept saying it was his favorite camping tool this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I really like that the legs are heavy duty and that grate seems easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This tripod grill is awesome. I've used it multiple times camping for many things. We used it for cooking all kinds of dinner dishes, to warm up cookies for dessert, held it a bit higher over the flame and warmed up shoes (or course we sanitized the grill after) but it was great! Easy to wash and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to use by moving one leg to avoid the heat of the fire. Perfect for cooking over a campfire!
customer_reviews.author: GoddessSekhmet

customer_reviews.title: Works great to cook food over an open fire.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Coleman tripod grill and lantern hanger specifically for my recent camping trip and it worked phenomenally. From hotdogs and hamburgers to steaks and potatoes, it did exactly what I expected it to. I would buy another in the future if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Kittle

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I like having this over the camp fire makes it easy for many tasks when camping and cooking. The only down side is clean up after the camping trip for it can turn your hands very black and messy. Quick fix is a pair of garden gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Must have camping accessory. I do wish the grate was a bit bigger, but that's only because we cook for a big family.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra F.

customer_reviews.title: Must have.
customer_reviews.text: It has skinnier ends that stake into the ground and is so easy to use. Make sure you bring your pot holders to move the lever up and down. We cooked corn and then grilled shrimp. Definitely a must have for camping!
customer_reviews.author: Miriah Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a lantern hanger.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly like what all the other reviews have said. The legs easily come apart, its not sturdy and I cannot imagine using it over an open flame. I bought it to hang a lantern for camping and for that purpose, it did the trick. As a lantern hanger, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Moonstone

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Very flinsy and cheaply made product. 2 out of 3 poles would not fit together without significant force and now wont come apart. Chain broke on first camping trip and grate bent from small dutch oven.
customer_reviews.author: ilya yefremov

customer_reviews.title: Not very useful
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy, it says it could be used to hold a cast iron pot.....there is no way that the chain could hold that and still give you the functionality to move it up and down without it breaking and falling in the fire.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap but the cords that hold them together don't last, will continue to use tho!
customer_reviews.author: jason peterson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the campers
customer_reviews.text: This is great quality. Easy to set up. Holds a lot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE L

customer_reviews.title: There are much better ones out there
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my misplaced one that we used all the time camping. Not impressed. Very filmsy construction, lightweight materials, and the bungee that keeps the leg pieces together is way too long and undersized. Even tied knots in the retaining cord and the legs still won't stay together.
customer_reviews.author: RDR

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Used this for camping, cooked for a large group of people. Wasn’t bad, it’s light weight, but the grate could use a lip to keep things from slipping. Works well for what it’s intended.
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: One modification needed.
customer_reviews.text: I had to close the "S" hook to keep the grate from falling off the chain. After a grate full of meat ended up on the fire, it was time to fix it. Other than that, its fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jer A.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. No sides so be careful to not overload one side of cooking area
customer_reviews.author: nicholas roach

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Used once and it broke. very light weight and items fall off. Placed a little to close to the fire and the rubber that holds the legs in place (inside) melted. Sorry i would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: rob cavalier

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.  Buy gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Used over an open fire this summer. I recommend buying a heat resistant grilling glove.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: which I like. It was also very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It was much larger than I expected it to be, which I like. It was also very easy to assemble. I do not expect to use the grill any time soon, but the lantern stand option is going to be very helpful for night fishing the spring and summer.
customer_reviews.author: Governor

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to any campsite, works great to keep food warm and cook for large groups over the campfire.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, not seeming safe over campfire.
customer_reviews.text: The poles needed to be tightened in order to stay together. The center grill swings when flipping burgers, it really took 2 people to keep it steady when moving and placing the food. It took some effort to get the triangle in a steady shape! I got what I paid for, should have gone with a higher end version of this design.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: this is amazing. My bf and I had a great time ...
customer_reviews.text: for the price, this is amazing. My bf and I had a great time cooking some chicken over a fire and looking forward to using this camping
customer_reviews.author: Lillian G.

customer_reviews.title: I bought one for my brother he liked it so much
customer_reviews.text: This was the big hit this year for our annual camping trip. I bought one for my brother he liked it so much. Don't tell him its a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Someone who cares

customer_reviews.title: Height of grill is adjustable to it's really easy to control cooking temp
customer_reviews.text: It works well, was able to hold a cast iron pan and cast iron pot over wood fire. Height of grill is adjustable to it's really easy to control cooking temp.
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: Permanent fixture at our firepit!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how we cooked without this!!! LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.author: J. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Crapola
customer_reviews.text: Broken after one camping trip. But I guess you get what you pay for lol
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Fiddly.
customer_reviews.text: Elastic holding the leg pieces together is very weak -- makes it very fiddly to put up. I'm sure it would be fine once it's set up and there's weight on it holding the legs together, but it's too fiddly for me so I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Val T

customer_reviews.title: Used every weekend spring summer and fall
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why the changed the ends to be stuck in the ground? They don’t make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Nemeth

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Have a 4' x 4' fire pit ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it . Have a 4' x 4' fire pit and cook almost everything on it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Kind of flimsy. Worked for one weekend and probably ...
customer_reviews.text: Kind of flimsy. Worked for one weekend and probably won't use again. My main frustration was that the poles come in sections so when you try to move the entire tripod the legs fall off! Such a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Viehman

customer_reviews.title: ive bought a half dozen camp grills in the past ...
customer_reviews.text: ive bought a half dozen camp grills in the past 10 years and im going to stick with this one because its so versatile. now ive got backup grills for both job sites and a fish camp!
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Love this for over our fire pit
customer_reviews.text: Love this for over our fire pit. Works great and we have so much fun trying all kids of different things on it.
customer_reviews.author: pagirl4life

customer_reviews.title: cook meat over a fire and it worked awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what its supposed to do....cook meat over a fire and it worked awesome!
customer_reviews.author: james t

customer_reviews.title: Tripod grill overall works ok. Make sure to purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: Tripod grill overall works ok. Make sure to purchase the handling glove Amazon recommends because the unit gets a bit hot and the center grill moves while flipping meat. Slings that holds the poles together did not stand the heat and melted.
customer_reviews.author: Mr H

customer_reviews.title: it's a great camping necessity for cooking meals
customer_reviews.text: I've seen it on other brands of tripods, but I wish it had handles that stick out from the grill part. When you're trying to flip a burger, lift a pizza, etc... it's impossible to hold it still. Outside of that, it's a great camping necessity for cooking meals.
customer_reviews.author: MommaC

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended but be careful to balance stuff on the grilling rack.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lousy design. Cords don't hold legs together when you try to stand it up so it falls apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Cheap made and missing parts upon delivery would not hold anything of weight
customer_reviews.author: The real deal

customer_reviews.title: I threw the legs in the garbage and used half inch emt conduit 3 six foot ...
customer_reviews.text: I threw the legs in the garbage and used half inch emt conduit 3 six foot pieces and went to a cable system. Smooth as silk now like expensive set up for very little money
customer_reviews.author: John Bruning

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit flimsy but it served our purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Maidagravity

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! It is well made, has a large cooking surface, and sets up quickly and easily. Love the fact that you can adjust the height for even cooking. A must for campers.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Box was very damaged
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to be in good condition but the box came severely damaged. Will know for sure in August.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect over a firepit
customer_reviews.text: works like i figured. you can adjust the height towards or away from the flame
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy - Fire Melts Elastic Pole Cords
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Buy. Used first time and heat of fire burned the inside elastic cords that keep poles together. EASY TO Tip when retrieving hanging pot for pouring or lading food from inside. Super disappointed in Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Purcell

product_meta.title: Coleman Tripod Grill and Lantern Hanger
product_meta.description: Grill up dinner over the campfire and then tell stories by lantern light with help from the Coleman Tripod Grill and Lantern Hanger. Easily adjust the 17-in. diameter grill grate so it hangs over the fire at the perfect height for just the right amount of heat. When the meal is done, use the tripod to hang a lantern for just enough campsite light. When the fun is done, the shock-corded, durable galvanized steel legs collapse for convenient storage.
feature_bullets: Shock-corded legs collapse for easy transport and storage

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
